biotools.summary: Fiddle (file drawer data liberation effort) is a tool to combat publication bias by getting research out of the file drawer and into the scientific community. Fiddle is a “matchmaking” tool designed to help researchers to identify the publication format that will work best for a particular dataset that may be hard to publish in traditional journals.
